description.narrative: The Disability-inclusive Development in the Pacific investment is comprised of several activity which contribute to Australia's regional efforts in the Pacific to increase the quality of life for people with disabilities. These will include an external review of the performance of the Pacific Disability Forum and Pacific Islands Forum Secretariat in progressing disability-inclusive development in the region; future partnership arrangements with Pacific Disability Forum; the Pacific Regional Disability Rights Dialogue supported by the International Foundation for Electoral Systems (IFES). These activities will add to the knowledge of what works in supporting inclusive development and governance across the Pacific region. The total value of this investment is $0.5 million over 4 years, starting 2015-16.
